instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
i see a little bit of liquid on <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.
L83 vp is short to ground too. so I changed both <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> from 00239 board.
I have probe nothing is short surrounding <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6300</CHIP>, but theres still no sound. no input output detected at all..
please help guide me for measurement.. thanks..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message: Is the audio codec detected in System Report?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
at the hardware tab : audio
Devices : ...
nothing shows. I assume codec is not detected then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message: Check all power rails of audio codec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
i assume power is from <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>, present on <CAPACITOR>C6203</CAPACITOR>.
<CAPACITOR>C6000</CAPACITOR> supply <SIGNAL>CS8409_VA_PLL</SIGNAL> 1.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6200</CHIP> is a bridge between PCH and audio codec (<CHIP>U6300</CHIP>).
Check <CHIP>U6360</CHIP> and the small coils from power rails of <CHIP>U6300</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6360</CHIP> is outputting <SIGNAL>L83_1V8</SIGNAL> , 1.8v.
both coil L6301 and and L6300 is transmitting correct 1.8v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message: theres 3.3v at both end of L6302. so good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
Check the resistors between <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and PCH.
Also check reset signals for <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>/300.

Be sure you've got good solders.
You should try chips from same donor board model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>-1303 is all good according to spec. 33 ohm.
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> 1.8v
<SIGNAL>CODEC_RST_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<RESISTOR>R6204</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound ( no input / output )
threads.message:
solved : <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>/300 is replaced from same board model.
maybe my donor is broken..
thanks for the help!
